Why would this mastermind serial killer in the climax of the film run off and leave his hostages in the bus? If he was as smart as they make him out to be, he would have killed every kid in that bus when Harry jumped on the roof, and left one to still hold hostage to keep Harry off. Then, Harry could have shot him before he killed the last hostage with a precision shot. That would've been a logical ending to Harry's "dirty" style. Instead, they choose the stupid ending where Harry becomes a hero without any consequences because the serial killer becomes an idiot. Godawful

One of the best well known films with Clint Eastwood, with one ofhis best lines ever. Belongs to the San Francisco Inspector 2211, or Dirty Harry, series.The lines - when exploiting the cool presence and charisma of Eastwood - are sometimes awesome. Too bad sometimes the same care does not show on other characters. The villain (great interpretation) is not very believable from the psychological point of view, and has no consistent behavior pattern throughout the movie. Some supporting characters would be dispensable: the wife of his first partner, Chico, and the second partner he gets after Chico is shot.The action is non-stop, breathtaking at times. Visually, the film resembles an adult comics series with fine attention to lighting details. Very well filmed in the way cameras are used too. Great choice of sets. Great atmosphere, sometimes we really feel in the 70's at San Francisco. Sometimes the all dark screen is a bit too prolonged. The sets were careful chosen to portrait a dark sense of a decaying city so there was no need to over do it, really.A great chance to view a film with awesome atmosphere, a constant thrill and an irresistible Clint Eastwood.

Dirty Harry will always be one of my 'Desert Island Movies'. A true classic. It was such a departure in it's time and even today has not lost it's impact. The traditional battle between good and evil, with the gloves off and good actually winning (albeit raising some interesting ethical questions along the way). A very powerful and shocking movie; one that changed the direction of movie writing for ever. I still can never hear that children's song 'row your boat' without thinking about that nutter Scorpio and getting a chill down my spine (outstanding acting by whoever played him by the way). Excellent one liners also. Dirty Harry, the cop who says less and does more.

Review title: Dirty Harry is a film and after that a leading film
Review_body: Popularity of works like Dirty Harry is more about the wave it created in a genre of it's own type (here thriller Genre), for this reason when someone writes about films like dirty harry must face the wave that film has unleashed and this is not fair. A work should be first analyzed independently to indicate its inherent values. Dirty harry is initially quiet entertaining work. The only aim the director had was entertain the viewers while producing the film, a job Don Siegel has fairly successfully done. Film wholly revolves around Clint Eastwood and it is his charisma that has kept dirty harry standing; Perhaps imagining someone other than Eastwood in the role of harry and gaining this amount of popularity for the film is completely vain. The biggest drawback to this movie is the villain pole of story(Scorpio). A character which hasn't been developed properly. It is very weak character. Opposing someone with this level of intelligence and ability (just compare Scorpio's intelligence and ability with zodiac's, it is said Scorpio's character inspired by his character and actions) for ransom (100000$ or 200000$) with the heads of a big city is eccentric and idiotic. The script does not provide any information about the biography and features of this character. The amount of information Which is scheduled to be presented about this serial killer,played by a weak actor for this role (Andrew Robinson) in this job is powerless and unsuccessful. To me it is strange why a professional director like don Siegel has used such an inept actor for villain role of his film. Perhaps if both the character and acting the villain role had been effective a better balance between positive and negative poles of the story would have been created and we would have a better movie. Since the first mission of the cinema and a movie is entertainment Dirty Harry must be respected; of course adequate respect, not exaggerated one. 7/10.

Now as a young lover of Clint Eastwood, people may say that my knowledge of films is a bit low, but i think different, i am a great fan of all Eastwood films and have watched all the ones i can find on the shelves. Now back to the point of the film, Dirty Harry, now as a huge Eastwood fan, people may think I'm biased film but i think this is one of the most perfect films ever made. The film has its mistakes, but what film doesn't. The storyline is perfect, the acting is perfect, everything is perfect. The movie contains one of the greatest Villains i have seen in a film and they haven been afraid to reveal his character at the beginning, rather than do a common thing and disguise him until the end. Clint Eastwood plays the absolute perfect cop, to have handed the job to Frank Sinatra would have been disastrous, Eastwood provides the perfect cop, he has a disregard for his own police forces rules that he should be defending, his legendary character was perfect. I do not feel that any other character would have been suitable because of the imposing figure of Clint Eastwood. Biased, but a clean, truthful response that well deserves 10 out of 10.

An action movie without any kind of depth. The movie works fine if you want to turn your brains off and relax. You don't need to do a lot of thinking watching Dirty Harry do his "dirty things". I just wish the creators of this movie would have done a little more brainwork for this one. It could have been a great movie. Now it's only really remembered for the legendary lines of Harry Callahan.Easwoods part in this movie is the thing that keeps the boat floating. Without him it would have sank fast. All the characters lacked dimensions. I really would have loved to hear more about the death of Harry's wife. He never really seemed upset about it. I'm thinking I'd like to see Harry get drunk and smash the bottle on the wall and then go in front of a mirror and just stare at himself and maybe break the mirror with his fist. If a movie is called Dirty Harry, I want to see a Harry that is dirty in more ways. It's all about one man but still you hardly get to know him at all.The bad guy, Scorpio, is such a screw up... One of the worst bad guys I've seen in movies. I'm not even going go there.I heard a lot about Dirty Harry before I finally saw it. I was having my expectations high and got quite disappointed. I do though understand why this is such a classic. I just wish people would be more realistic when they talk about this movie. It's way overrated.

What I like about Dirty Harry is the Clint Eastwood performance in the greatest city I've ever been.... straightforward story, no pretentious acting, the 70's setting and music.... great.When I visited San Fansisco several times in the late 90's, sometimes it felt as if Inspector Callahean might appear around the next corner. It gave my trips a special dimension.Although I think Clint Eastwood is not a great actor, the Callahan character seems to fit to only him. The best Clint Eastwood performance ever. A monumental movie.
A classic thriller one of Clint and dons best films
